Google Play, also known as the Google Play Store and formerly Android Market.
Android Market was an online store offering software applications designed for Android devices, retired in 2017.
Session based installer for bundled/split APKs
Recommended, in-built and supports all Android versions
Shell based installer using root permissions
Requires root/superuser privileges, supports all Android versions.
Intent based installer, available on all devices
Best suited for devices running below Android 4.4
Requires Aurora Services to be installed as a privileged-system app
Requires App Manager, need adb/root mode to install when miui optimization is on
Using system APIs directly with adb/root privileges
Requires Shizuku or Sui, needs to be setup and permission granted

Have questions? Find out the answers
The GNU General Public License v3.0
Learn how Ticpass uses your data

Ticpass enables you to search and download apps from the official Google Play Store. You can check app descriptions, screenshots, updates, other users' comments, and download the APK directly from Google Play to your device. To use Ticpass, you need to have a Google Play account, and log in to your Google Play account when you first open and configure Ticpass.

Unlike a traditional app store, Ticpass does not own, license or distribute any apps. All the apps, app descriptions, screenshots and other content in Ticpass are directly accessed, downloaded and/or displayed from Google Play. Ticpass works exactly like a door or a browser, allowing you to log in to your Google Play account and find the apps from Google Play.

Please note that Ticpass does not have any approval, sponsorship or authorization from Google, Google Play, any apps downloaded through Ticpass or any app developers; neither does Ticpass have any affiliation, cooperation or connection with them.
Removes Ticpass as the device owner app
This will revoke session installer\'s permission to silently install app. Proceed with clearing device ownership?
View and manage token dispensers for anonymous logins
Add a token dispenser to Ticpass. Token dispensers provide account credentials to Ticpass for logging in anonymously.
Do you wish to remove the dispenser \"%1$s\"?
